result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Order for Dismissal
DCA Order for Stay & Order for Dismissal_1 - Castellanos Avila, Rene.docx

3:18 PM Defendant Rene Castellanos Avila in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Rene Castellanos Avila.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Laura Salcido Sworn on oath as interpreter. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Parties have agreed to a deferred prosecution agreement. Guilty Plea entered on Count 1. Defendant advised of voting rights. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. The Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1. The Court approves the agreement. The DA to submit an order for the Court to sign.

8:29 AM Defendant Rene Castellanos Avila in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Rene Castellanos Avila.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over 30 days for a deferred prosecution agreement.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Rene Castellanos Avila in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Rene Castellanos Avila.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Sally Nichols Sworn on oath as interpreter. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to the preliminary hearing. The Court is given a waiver of preliminary hearing form. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Defendant waives reading of information.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond continues. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
